author: m.kalinin
content: are we sure about all of them? There was a comment on the cal that some libraries are little-endian. The precompile should be big-endian, and if a client uses little-endian crypto lib it will do a conversion. My thought was to avoid changing the library used by the CL pyspec by using a wrapper on a low level of the spec

author: 0x_qz
content: Hi there, I am from the EthStorage team. We are currently working on building a storage layer 2 based on the 4844 testnet. The whole process is to send data blob tx and retrieve the corresponding EL block number through an emitted event, and then download the blob using the CL API, which is similar to http://cl-server/eth/v1/beacon/blocks/slotNumber. Unfortunately, we are unsure how to obtain the slot number by the EL block number. Is there a recommended method to achieve this? We believe this is a common question for all layer 2 implementations.

author: ajsutton
content:
You can’t go from execution block number to slot number but you can go from execution block timestamp to slot because slots are a fixed 12 seconds starting from the genesis time (the CL has an api to get the genesis time if you need it). 
Not ideal but I think it’s the best you can do until the beacon block root is available in the execution block.
